CAP. XIX.

An att for granting to his Majesty the sum of eight hundred thousand pounds, to be raised by annuities transferr able at the bank of England^ and for afcertaining the customs and duties upon quick-fifaer taken as prize during the present war \ and for the further appropriating the fupplies granted in this session of parliament.

Mo ft gracious Sovereign,

WE your Majesty’s moft dutiful and loyal fubje&s the commons of Great Britain in parliament affembled, being de-firous to raife the neceffary fupplies which we have chearfully granted to your Majesty, in the ealieft manner we are able, for the benefit of your fubjefts, have freely and voluntarily given and granted, and by this act do give and grant unto your Ma-jefty the sum of eight hundred thousand pounds, to be raised in such manner and form as is herein after directed j and to that end do moft humbly befeech your Majesty that it may be enacted ; and be it enadfed by the King’s most excellent majesty, by and with the advice and confent of the lords spiritual and temporal, and commons, in this present parliament affembled, and by the authority of the fame. Additional duties on Ipi-rituous liquors.

For every gallon of low wines, or fpirits of the firfb extraction, made or drawn from any foreign or imported materials or any mixture therewith, to be paid by the diftillers or makers thereof, threepence.

For every gallon of low wines, or fpirits of the first extraction, made or drawn only from any fort of drink or wafh, brewed or made from any fort of malt or corn, other than except brewers wafh or tilts, to be paid by the diftillers or makers thereof, one halfpenny.

For every gallon of low wines, or fpirits of the first extraction, made or drawn from brewers wafh or tilts, or mixture therewith, to be paid by the diftillers or makers thereof, one halfpenny.

For every gallon of low wines, or fpirits of the first extraction, made or drawn from any other fort or kind of Englifh materials, or any mixture therewith, to be paid by the diftillers or makers thereof, three farthings.
